summary: the porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV) is a highly contagious, enteric disease of swine. it is characterized by severe enteritis, vomiting, watery diarrhea, and weight loss. PEDV has a substantial detrimental effect on the swine industry due to its high mortality rates among suckling piglets. the scFv gene was obtained from the hybridoma cell 6E6 secreting the monoclonal antibody against PEDV S protein. the recombinant scFv protein was successfully expressed in Escherichia coli using the prokaryotic expression vector pGEX-6p-1 with a GST-tag. a complementary overlapping sequence encoding a flexible linker of 12 amino acids was added to the 5′ ends of the VH reverse primers and VL forward primers. a complementary overlapping sequence encoding a flexible linker of 12 amino acids (SSGGGGGGGS) was added to the 5′ ends of the VH reverse primers and VL forward primers. the amplified products of the VL and VH genes were purified using the Qiaquick Gel Extraction Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) an overlap extension PCR (SOE-PCR) was performed for generation of the scFv gene of the MAb 6E6. the scFv/6E6 gene was digested using the restriction endonucleases BamH I and Xho I. the ligation products were transformed into E. coli DH5 cells. the positive plasmids were selected to determine the sequence of the scFv/6E6 gene. the gel-cutting band containing the recombinant scFv/6E6 protein was cut from the stained gel. the gel-cutting band was loaded into the D-TubeTM Dialyzer Mini with MWCO 12–14 kDa (Merck) and 2.5 mL of tris-glycine SDS running buffer was added to the loaded tube. electroelution of the loaded tube was run in a horizontal electrophoresis chamber. membrane was incubated with IRDyeTM 700DX-conjugated affinity purified anti-mouse IgG (H&L, goat, 1:8000 dilution in PBS) the results of the Western blot were analyzed using the ODYSSEYTM Infrared Imaging System (Li-Cor Biosciences, Lincoln, NE) RNA extraction and cDNA
